intro: Stylidium oreophilum, commonly known as the mountain stickseed, is a small flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit. The plant features linear, succulent leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers with prominent staminodes. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils, often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Stylidium oreophilum is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
